The Swiss victory in the Swabian War (1499) against the Swabian League of Emperor Maximilian I, and the Swiss victory in the Burgundian Wars (1477–1478, 1479–1481, 1482–1493) against Charles the Bold of Burgundy, cemented Swiss independence.
